summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. It details allegations of a multi-year scheme from 2002-2005 involving dozens of underage victims in New York and Florida, where Epstein used employees and victim-recruiters to maintain a supply of girls for sexual exploitation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. Allegedly operated a scheme from 2002-2005 to sexually exploit dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida, using employees and victim-recruiters.

Epstein allegedly worked with several employees and associates to contact victims, schedule encounters, and facilitate the sex trafficking scheme.
Epstein is accused of sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of underage girls, paying them for sex acts, and paying some to recruit other victims.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on Saturday, July 6, 2019.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed and Charges Announced
events.description: The indictment charging Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy was unsealed in Manhattan federal court. A press release was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Alleged Sex Trafficking Scheme
events.description: The period during which Epstein allegedly enticed and recruited dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him at his residences in New York and Florida, creating a network of victims.

events.title: Expected Initial Court Appearance
events.description: Epstein was expected to be presented in Manhattan federal court before Magistrate Judge Henry B. Pitman on the afternoon of July 8, 2019.

locations: New York, New York (specifically, Epstein's Upper East Side mansion referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Palm Beach, Florida (specifically, Epstein's estate referred to as the 'Palm Beach Residence')
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, and charged on July 8, 2019, with one count of sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and one count of conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The indictment alleges the criminal conduct occurred from at least 2002 through at least 2005, involving dozens of minor girls, some as young as 14.
Epstein allegedly operated a scheme where he paid victims for sex acts and paid some victims to recruit other underage girls, creating a 'vast network' of victims.
The alleged abuse took place at Epstein's residences on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, New York, and in Palm Beach, Florida.
The press release includes a public call for other potential victims or witnesses to contact the FBI at 1-800-CALL-FBI.
